column4: when I startup, it says there was a problem with fsck and I have to fix it manually. naturally i just press ctrl+D cuz i don't know how to but would this have anything to do with why linux runs so slow?
it could be you should go with the recovery
how do i go with recovery?
you reboot the machine, as it is starting in grub you hit escape and then choose recovery then just type >>fsck -y<< and hit enter
